title: Glenmark's FabiFlu approved for coronavirus treatment in India, costs Rs 103 per tablet
content: Mumbai-based Glenmark Pharmaceuticals have launched a new antiviral drug - Favipiravir with brand name FabiFlu - for the treatment of mild to moderate Covid-19 patients. The firm has become the first Indian company to commercially launch an antiviral drug. Indian drug regulator Drug Controller Ge

title: Covid-19: Markaz attendees are hiding, says Maharashtra home ministry
content: The Maharashtra home ministry said around 50-60 Markaz attendees are trying to hide and their mobile phones are switched off. The police are trying to locate them across the state. title: China sold the PPEs it got as a donation from Italy to Italy: Report
Coronavirus: Australian scientists begin tests of potential vaccines
content:
Scientists in Australia have begun testing two potential coronavirus vaccines in "milestone" lab trials.
The vaccines, made by Oxford University and US company Inovio Pharmaceutical, have been cleared for animal testing by the World Health Organization.

Bollywood actor Ajay Devgn has rubbished rumors related to his actress-wife Kajol and daughter Nysa's health.

title: Stones pelted on doctors in Indore while tracking a man who came in contact with COVID-19 patient.
content:
Indore: Stones were pelted on a team of health officials while they were trying to trace a person who had come into contact with a COVID-19 patient earlier.
The incident occurred in Taat Patti Bakhal area when the team of five was trying to find out the whereabouts of the person.

title: People of Tablagi Jamaat who were spitting deliberately, doctors also upset: Nizamuddin was taken for investigation
content: There has been a stir in the whole of Delhi since the arrival of 200 Muslims from the mosque located in Nizamuddin area of ​​Delhi. title: Chamki fever in Corona's havoc, first patient found in Bihar
content:
New Delhi. Right now, where Coronavirus has created panic all over the country, the knock of Chamki Fever has further increased the problem of people. Its first case has been reported in Muzaffarpur, Bihar. A child is said to have been admitted to the hospital due to chlamydia fever.

title: Coronavirus: Modi announces 'PM CARES Fund', Please contribute whatever you can
content:
NEW DELHI: As India grapples with the coronavirus outbreak, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday announced that an "emergency fund" has been constituted as people from all walks of life expressed their desire to donate to the country's war against COVID-19.
